Reviews.Title: “Out-dated hotel - Destroy and Rebuild”
Reviews.Author: SSalzman
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn’t deserve to be called Comfort Inn & Suites! It’s old and should be destroyed. The rooms stink of cigarette smoke, the carpet is dingy, the toilet continuously runs, the air conditioner sound like a freight train, there is no microwaves or refrigerators, the internet is the slowest I’ve seen in years, the TV has limited stations, you must let the water run for fifteen minutes before it gets warm enough to shower, the parking is insecure, and the price is too high! I hope I don't have to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Carlos O
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel about 4 or 5 times. In the end of february to March 7 we spend 9 nights there and we loved. It is located just 5 minutes from Miami Intl Airport. We arrived very early in the morning. Kevin, who works at front desk was very kind and invited us to have breakfast which was wonderful. At 9:30 am there was a room available for us. We were very pleased for the size of the room - large, clean and very comfortable. We have already made a new reservation for the beginning of April. We highly recommend this hotel. Ja nos hospedamos neste hotel 4 ou 5 vezes. Estivemos la por oito noites no final de fevereiro ate o dia 7/03 deste ano. Chegamos bem cedo e normalmente os hoteis nao permitem fazer chek-in antes das 15h00. Kevin, o funcionario da recepcao,muito gentilmente nos permitiu tomar cafe da manha, o que e maravilhoso, e nos encaminhou a uma suite maravilhosa, ampla e limpa as 9h30min da manha. Recomendamos este hotel, pois alem da localizacao (perto do aeroporto), o acesso e facil para todos os lugares. O cafe da manha e otimo, com wafer, bagel, ovos mexidos, sucos, cereais, muffin, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Really?? and we stayed here...”
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only old, but needs to be remodeled. I can stay at old, but there were bugs on the bathroom floor & it smelled. The front desk was very nice, but hardly makes up for the old & rather dirty. I think we could have stayed somewhere else for same price & have been better accomodations. Stayed here Feb 11th before cruise & again Feb 18, 2012 when got back. Don't make the same mistake we did. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: 50Penny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice: three nights while we visited Miami area and again one night before our flight home. Hotel is adequate but nothing special. No problems parking in the large lot next to hotel. Took about 20 minutes to get to South Beach area in the morning and about 45 minutes to get back at night. Breakfast the usual hotel fare. Shuttle to airport was very convenient. Staff was polite and helpful. Way cheaper than staying in Miami Beach so we were satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Was good for price”
Reviews.Author: fareesha
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here and it was okay for a 2 night stay, my only complaint was there was a very high stench as soon as I exited the elevator and I had to literally run to my room before breathing. Other than that the room was huge and the bathroom looked a little dated. Internet connectivity was very poor and the ac in our room didn't work that well. This saty was a little worse than our first stay and it had a lot to do with location of our room. Ask for the airport view side and high room in the newer tower. I really don';t like their breakfast so I normally skip it. parking was okay, got one of the last spots at 11pm one night.

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: sbidwell
Reviews.Content: First off, they said they had shared access to the neighboring hotel's pool and they didn't. Our room was not ready at 3:00pm as stated and the some of the staff was rude. The airport shuttle runs only every 30 minutes and they only have one shuttle. We had an early flight out and wanted to ride the 5:00am shuttle but it was full so we had to wait for the 5:30. Bed was comfortable but I was not impressed with this hotel. There's lots of other hotels to choose from around the airport - I recommend you keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: justgolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here night before flight out of Miami Intl. Easy access with 24 hour airport shuttle. Dated, but clean. Parked for 8 days at $6 per day while traveling. Good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: HertfordshirePandora
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a safe, peaceful location. It is conveniently located for the car rental terminal and has a reliable complimentary shuttle to and from the airport. It has a spacious free car park and a good buffet breakfast is included in the price of the room. It is good value for money compared with many others in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A low (er) cost option for MIA”
Reviews.Author: Twixle
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights here Jan2012, used car to access with no parking problems either in front of hotel or adjacent parking lot. Ok, it's a mid price hotel with dare I say mid price clientelle but it proved to be perfectly usable and comfortable. The counter staff are welcoming and friendly, the rooms do look dated but are big with comfortable beds. A lick of paint and tidy up wouldnt go amiss but it is adequate, I wouldnt call it unclean just well used! The breakfast is a fairly basic mix of cereal/waffle/fruit/coffee juices etc. I noticed a Denny's and McD's a modest walk from the hotel but there isnt much else nearby. You are unlikely to be using this as a holiday destination but it is fine for a short stop very close to Miami airport and I felt safe around site at all times.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque74
Reviews.Content: The room was adequate, and the staff was friendly. In order to make use of the Wi-Fi, you have to sit through a long advertisement prior to connecting. The food at the restaurant was barely edible. I'm sure we will stay in this area in the future, but it will not be at this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel if you want near the airport but.....”
Reviews.Author: MCS0027
Reviews.Content: At check-in the gentleman at the front desk was very friendly and helpful. If you happen to have a car with you good luck with the parking as its a nightmare at this hotel. When we got to our room, for what we paid, I was really disappointed in the overall quality of the room. It was rather shaggy and didn't look to be the cleanest of rooms we've stayed in but it was decent. If you plan on using the internet best of luck to you as it was like using dial-up and continued to kick me off so many times I finally gave up. If you need to call the front desk because you need something or as with us we didn't have a working remote you probably won't get it. After fifteen minutes the desk called back to say sorry housekeeping was closed so they couldn't help. Overall this is an okay hotel but for the price its not worth it. Go right across the street to the Sleep Inn as we did on the second night and you'll be much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Strictly a Utilitarian Option, Needed a place near the airport”
Reviews.Author: FloridaScamp
Reviews.Content: I just had a quick two day stint in Miami for business. Meeting my boss and needed a functional place that wasn't "Miami" priced. Optioned for the airport since the other party was staying close by at another hotel. The hotel was strictly utilitarian. Check-in was 15+ minutes, parking was convenient. Shortcomings: heat did not work, drain in bath tub would not stay open, door was difficult to close, exit stairs were external to building so only option was elevator. Again use this hotel for last minute deal or as a fall back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and great service”
Reviews.Author: jeff p
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was very accomodating and went out of their way to make the stay very nice. Many of the staff did not speak english as their first language, but they understood / talked enough to answer questions. I asked the front desk manager if he would open the pool early (before 6am) which he happily did. I would definitely stay here again; except Miami itself is not so great in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for Overnight - Had no Problems”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasPamela56
Reviews.Content: We arrived on late (11:30 p.m.) on a Sunday night (12/4/11) and had a fairly quick check-in. We had a mid-morning flight out the next day. This is an older property, yes, however, we did not detect any smells as some have posted. The room was fine, very standard, but sufficient for us. Room was clean and we did not see any broken items. We had the comp breakfast the next morning and it was great. Many different items to choose from, even a belgium waffle maker, hot and cold cereals, breads, rolls, patries, fruit, eggs, sausage, bacon, all kinds of drinks, served in a cute little dining room. The hotel's complimentary van delivered us to the airport the next morning with no problem. I do not understand some of the negative comments, but, again, we were only there overnight. I would definitely use this hotel again for a 'layover' type situation.

Reviews.Title: “Given someone else's room...”
Reviews.Author: qwertybailey
Reviews.Content: We were given an occupied room upon check in. The front desk was not apologetic and took a while to assign us another room (like it was our fault someone else did not check out). The room was old and dingy and the cleaning was just okay. The lighting was dim and the switches were messed up. Breakfast was plentiful, but nothing tasted very good (stick with fruit and yogurt).

Reviews.Title: “Very old and delipated rooms”
Reviews.Author: GrammaT54
Reviews.Content: Carpet very smelly, was a non-smoking room that reaked of smoke. Wallpaper peeling off walls, old, old bathroom, tiles falling off walls, furniture vaneer peeling, lights but no switch to turn it on, and was right next to a very noisy elevator. I will never stay there again, and am not sure about Comfort Suites at all either.

Reviews.Title: “Barely OK for 1 night stay at a reasonable price before cruise”
Reviews.Author: joshuaChicago
Reviews.Content: Room was OK sized but badly in need of decorating; Newer lobby area gives false expectations of room quality; OK for one-night stay before cruise; Not much to do in area that has several lower-priced hotels/motels near airport; Complimentary shuttle from airport-shuttle to cruise port runs $10 per person; So-so breakfast included in price; Front-desk were pleasant but gave wrong or misleading answers to queries about places to go in nearby area

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe area...”
Reviews.Author: virginiaLaGrangeKy
Reviews.Content: Very unsafe area-room not clean-refrigerator/freezer iced over-toilet didn't flush-required maintanence to come and fix it-I ordered dinner delivered and hardly slept as the hotel was so noisy. Expedia will never book a hotel for me again .

Reviews.Title: “It's possible to have been less than terrible...”
Reviews.Author: Mort69
Reviews.Content: On arrival... okay, we (2 couples) were early because we came off a cruise at Port Everglades. I figured there would be a need to kill some time in between, and that was confirmed on arrival. But maybe with a smile and some understanding? No. Front Desk manager was curt and rude. Don't bother coming back until 3. Yes, I asked if earlier was going to be possible. Silly me. We had shopping to do and had a rental car, so killed 2 hours. we returned to the hotel to find we were the only people waiting at the front desk when we walked in. Perfect! Or so you'd think. Despite the fact that there were 4 desk staff present, we waited for a conversation to be completed before we were helped. And even then, one at a time. It is possible they could have been less helpful, but how much remains to be seen. Rooms assigned after my friend was told his room was not ready. A quick check said otherwise. Into the room by 3:30. The elevator stunk. The floor stunk on opening. And the room stinks too. I suspect it is not a result of not being clean, but rather the musty smell of old air conditioning. Opening the door confirms the furniture and decor is c. 1960's and it smells like it. It's pretty grungy with torn wallpaper, wood chips missing from the door surface, old unlatched holes in the walls, etc. But it does appear that the people who work here try to keep it clean to the best of their ability. It's harder to keep an old property clean than it is to do so with new stuff. A single facecloth and single hand towel greet us in the bathroom. We will call for another of each. The lights work, the TV works, and we didn't pay a lot for a location close to the airport. So if that's a tradeoff for you, it may be okay. There are amenities close by such as Denny's, IHOP, Pizza Hut, etc. within walking distance. No pool here. Apparently you have to walk across the street to a sister property if you want to use one. In summary, old and smelly. Clean as it gets for this age of property though. Staff service below terrible. This is a busy place, and I am sure they run full most of the time. If you have a choice, spend a few dollars more and go someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for one/couple nights stay between the cruise/flight.”
Reviews.Author: Egoetrexmeus
Reviews.Content: Spanish speaking check-in lady was very friendly, same about the housekeeping staff. Got a handicapped room, which was not a problem at all. It was clean, spacious and quiet (in spite facing the airport) with comfortable bed and large TV. Restaurant is very simple and nothing special , complimentary breakfast was ok.There are some fast food options in the vicinity, but did not feel safe walking around there after dark. Airport shuttle was efficient. Recommended for one/couple nights stay between the cruise/flight.

Reviews.Title: “Clean And Thrilled to Find It”
Reviews.Author: LaurieSusan
Reviews.Content: We were getting desperate for a room and after finding it full, we booked online and found a room right away. Didn't have any of the problems others complained of. Our room was more than adequate, comfortable and clean. The man at the desk didn't seem too friendly but when we told him we had no suitcases and were stuck because of a flight problem at the airport, he kindly found us deodorant, razors, shaving cream, lotion, extra shampoo and rinse. We were very grateful for his kindness and enjoyed the room. Beds were comfortable and sheets nice. No smell. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: marcidavis
Reviews.Content: On September 29th, we flew into the Miami Airport, and had a reservation at this hotel. I had requested a non-smoking king room (my husband is 6'6" and I have allergies). Upon check-in, I asked the desk clerk if the room she assigned us was definitely a non-smoking room. She said yes. We get to the 2nd floor, and as soon as you step off of the elevator, you smell stale smoke. Well, let's go see the room - just in case. The room stunk so badly of stale smoke and came with an ashtray and matches. That's quite interesting for a NON-SMOKING room. We got changed to the 4th floor which was non-smoking, but the room was so dirty and came with a gecko running loose. Luckily, we had to leave early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “I had a nice time here”
Reviews.Author: Huntraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for a week (earlier than 2010, but I couldn't set up that date). Carnival Cruise Lines had booked a room for me. When I'd arrived there were not available room for crewmember like me, but finally I got a suite.Big luck. It was pretty large, the bed was excellent and the bathroom was really huge. The Wi-Fi system was full of ads, but I had internet cable, so I could connect to the internet by wire and it was fast and free in this way. The Dockyard Cafe was good. The half spring chicken was really nice and huge. The surroundings were nice. Miami Springs beautiful parks are in walking distance. Yes, the pool was belonnged to the neighbour hotel, but the Miami Beach is reachable by bus no.7( approx 50 minutes) if you won't take a car or taxi. It's a perfect location for young travelers like me. I had enjoyed my time at this hotel. Also the shuttle bus to the airport was pleasant for me as the colours red-white-green is the same like my country's flag :)

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A MISTAKE”
Reviews.Author: NORMARK2
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here on our way to the Keys. We figured it was better to stay 1 night in Miami rather that drive out to the Keys late at night. This hotel has a smell that hits you as you walk in the front door. It is an old building. Our room also had a similar smell. While the floor and room were non smoking, I believe from the smell that smoking was once permitted. Our room had no wash cloths or hand towels. Only bath towels. Also, our reservation was for a room with 2 queen beds. We got 2 full beds. Now, I did not complain about the beds or towels. It was late, we were tired and knew we were leaving early the next morning. I feel you should get what you reserved and that towels & wash cloths should be in the room without asking. The room was clean, freshly dusted & vacuumed. The complimentary was fair. I took a couple donuts that were damp and stale. That was after standing for almost 10 minutes waiting for an eleavator. It looked like only 1 of the 2 were working.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: StephaDaniel
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel around 4pm on June 22, extremely weary after our 10 hour flight from Madrid, the clerk (desk manager) greeted us warmly and was most helpful with the check-in process. Choice Hotels had failed to register that the room was to be compensated through my award points program and the clerk was able to contact Choice and straighten out the matter. Needless to say, we were pleased. In addition, he showed us how to get the bus to the beach and gave us a map. We were pleasantly surprised at his generous help. In addition, the room was very clean and comfortable, and the breakfast was great! We highly recommend this well-run hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for..Proximity to the Airport/Beach/ and eats”
Reviews.Author: Cruisimel80
Reviews.Content: We had a day and a half layover in Miami after our trip to Guatemala. I traveled with 17 people...7 adults and 10 teenagers. I had read reviews before hand and my expectations were low however I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel though older has large rooms which with 4 women in a room the extra space was nice. Pros: *MIAMI BEACH (one of my new favorite places) is proabaly 20 min away with traffic *There are plenty of eats close by *It was truly within 5 min of the airport *Though older in appearance the facility is nice *Pool *Comfy beds and large bathrooms ( though the tub was garden style I found it small) *Breakfast (I slept in and missed this so I'm unsure of how good it was or wasn't) *GIFT STORE!! I was pretty grateful for this as it has souvenirs, snacks and clothing/flip flops etc. I picked up a cute sundress at the store for not a bad price at all *(Just a heads up though we went to a store in Miami Beach and found the same dresses for $5 less. BUT the convenience of having the store in our hotel was worth it!!) Cons: *I had to call twice for towels before they were brought up:/ *The pool is located at the Sleep Inn a block over. This was somewhat of an inconvenience as a couple older women in our group wanted to go there but did not want to walk in the heat. Overall I thought it was a great stay and if I'm in Miami again...which I hope to be..loooved the city!! I will most likely stay here as it's reasonably priced and very convenient!! Fyi...the chinese restaurant next to the hotel.. Ping House is a no go. We ate there for lunch and the food was mediocre and the wait staff messed up my bill 3x. I thought maybe the first individual added the bill up incorrectly only to find out it was the same individual who added it wrong all 3x. Each time it increased by $3. Another friend was charged for a drink incorrectly and overall our crew just did not like the food. We did go to Outback not to far from the hotel and we enjoyed it. Our group was big but the wait was not long, service was great and the food was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Mistakes happen”
Reviews.Author: luxury4less
Reviews.Content: Made the mistake of booking this hotel. While we typically only choose 4 star hotels, I was being overly frugal...landed in Miami at 830PM and connecting flight was next morning, so just needed a quick place to sleep...won't make that mistake again. You truly get what you pay for. I should have tossed the $65 in the trash and just booked another hotel. Old property with strange smells in a less than desirable location. Just not worth it. Slept in my clothes just in case. Last year booked Sofitel Miami and while it was just OK, I would stay there again...NEVER will I stay in any of the Comfort Suite (or other brands under the Choice umbrella).

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Comfort Suites was not a bad one”
Reviews.Author: LRahm
Reviews.Content: Positive: Comfortable bed, clean room, clean hotel, quiet, not a bad price, good location as far as convenience goes, no roaches or insects, the amenities. Negative: Terrible customer service, so bad I wouldn't even call it service. A/C kept shutting off, breakfast was bland, there were patched of repairs that needed to be done in the room (like a small hole in the wall with a wire coming out). Did I say terrible service?? The lady at the check in desk seemed very perturbed by our presence upon checking in, the attitude was mirrored by everyone we encountered at that desk during our entire FIVE day and night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: RR-Argentina
Reviews.Content: This is a good option to stay one night close to the airport. We arrived to MIA airport at 9.00 PM and had another flight al 10.00 AM and selected this hotel. Very good shuttle service. Comfortable room. Good service restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “need renovation but ok for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: montreal010
Reviews.Content: Pick up is fast from the airport. Have to wait to 3 PM to check in. Room is big but smelled of smoke for non-smoking room and humidity. Wall have stains from leaking water and peeled off wall paper. I got a room facing away from the airport so quiet. Swimming pool is not on site but you have to go to Sleep Inn next door for it because both hotels share one. Fast food restaurants near the hotel but nothing else in term of shopping or sight seeing around the hotels. Shuttles run every half hour even at night so a plus, the shuttle driver seems surprise when I gave him tips.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: ferretpeople
Reviews.Content: Although the reviews for this hotel were mixed, there were more good than bad. I now believe the bad ones. The lobby and 3 different rooms all smelled bad. Kind of a mildew, cigarette smoke, old food smell. Also, we arrived around 8pm and the only place to eat was at their little snack bar. The only restaurant nearby was closed and it's not a neighborhood I'd recommend walking around in at night. We went across the street to the Homestead Studio Suites and they were willing to meet Comfort's price so we stayed there. VERY NICE!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Pattitraveler
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving our nonsmoking room with a King bed wasn't ready... At 8:00 at night! They tried giving us a smoking room with double beds. I don't care about the beds, it's the smoke that grosses us out. So we finally got a non-smoking room. The dank pit hallways resemble dirty alleys. Our T.V. Didn't work, 2 lights in our room didn't work and the sheets had long dark hairs imbedded in them. GROSS!! The site makes you think that the hotel has a pool... Well not on sight! You have to walk across the street to use the pool (it's shared with The Sleep Inn) They also show pictures of a nice fitness center on the 7th floor. Well that's all boarded up, the "fitness center" is now downstairs in a small, cramped room. I advise everyone to take a pass on The Dank Pit Inn and Suites.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: alexplore
Reviews.Content: A nice spacious room with pleasant view. Really convenient shuttle from and to airport. Older facility that is ready for updating. Nothing really bad (except the smokers always hanging out by front doors). Most complaints are just little things, but they add up. Wi-fi hit or miss, breakfast not up to Comfort Inn standards, etc.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: flame01
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the start of march 2011. I booked in advance and requested a room facing the airport as high as possible. When I arrived I had a rook on the 10th Floor (11 is the highest) and where I wanted it The rooms were fine, clean, tidy and functional. My only gripe is with the Wireless Internet..although it worked ( most of the time) the ISP that the hotel uses was blocking my email. When I contacted the help number provided by the hotel I was told that it was an issue I would have to take up with hotel management !!! The internet also bombed me we advertisements on a small ar across teh top of my screen.....driving me crazy and making me wonder why they do this Otherwise it was good, teh breakfast was Ok for a continental B'fats but the room was packed most mornings Would I stay again .. yes

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and convenient choice for our airline connection”
Reviews.Author: MooreaLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at the Comfort Suites before our connection to Barbados the next morning. It was a perfectly adequate choice hotel - very, very clean, comfortable bed and typical Choice hotel breakfast. We arrived just after 10:00 p.m. and really wanted to get something from the bar to wind down. The bar had closed but we stuck our heads in and asked if there was any way we could just get a beer. The bartender re-opened his closed cash register and was more than happy to accommodate us. We had a restful sleep and after an extremely quick and efficient checkout we were on the airport shuttle back to the Miami airport the next morning. Both coming and going back to the airport the shuttle was extremely reliable. This was a great start to our wonderful vacation with prompt front desk service, a comfortable and clean room, and efficient shuttle service. Don't let the bad reviews stop you from staying here. They are more than happy to help in any way they can.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but run down.”
Reviews.Author: gary2you
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the rooms were very clean, but the place is really run down. The walls look like they've had issues, but were just painted over. Not a great presentation for the Choice family of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for price”
Reviews.Author: poty13
Reviews.Content: It's a comfort Inn, you have to know that when youÂ´re booking it. It's not 5stars but is perfect if youÂ´re not looking for luxury. Clean & big rooms, near the airport, not a bad price, free wireless, free parking, shutlle very reliable and a big plus for me its that there is a car rental on the hotel (ABC) with great deals (so I don't have to depend on renting on the airport). I've stayed a lot on this hotel (more than 10 times) and will always come back. But be adviced, is perfect if you have a car, if not is too far from Miami attractions and the buses are hard to take. And for the people looking for shopping... its near Dolphin mall & international mall (in car)

Reviews.Title: “Praise for the Comfort Inn. Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: vacationer16
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitant about staying in this hotel when i first booked. Since the hotel is not even rated a 3 star, i was very worried and even thought of cancelling my reservation. I am glad i didn't! The hotel itself is well mainteined. Staff is very courteous and the free parking, free breakfast, free internet and all other perks are worth staying here. Rooms are very clean and comfortable, housekeeping does a great job and i did not have a problem at all during this stay. Rooms are exactly as you see them in the website pictures. I would stay here again without a problem. Recommend to all of you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: bulldog3777
Reviews.Content: I am at the hotel now. We are going on a cruise and stayed here last night. Has been great for us. Very clean, very large room and very friendly staff. We are three couples and all of us are very pleased. Airport pickup free and $10 a person to take you to the cruise port. Great sports bar down the street with very good food. Ihop close for breakfast if you don't want to eat the free breakfast they offer. I just like Ihop. I have no complaints at all and get tired of people trashing places in reviews. It causes me to skip some possibly nice places. Our room did face the airport but I did not notice any real noise, especially after 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a good bath and sleep”
Reviews.Author: FTT74
Reviews.Content: I loved the shower, it has different kinds of flow. The reception desk supervisor, Frank, was a diferential, very kind. The carpets weren't so clean, we couldn't walk around without a shoe - and this is not good when you have a 2-year old daughter who wants to stay barefoot all the time. We stayed there due to problems with our flight and we had just checked out from another Choice Hotels. But I'm not sure if I had stayed here if I had time to search for other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: bnl8508
Reviews.Content: This hotel is super clean and the staff members are very helpful and accomodating. Mr J.C. Vera the area sales manager, took the time to help my sister and I after we had trouble getting our tickets for a cruise the next day to print. He even told us about some local events that were occuring in Miami and surrounding areas that week.

Reviews.Title: “Should have been better, it was Miami”
Reviews.Author: Traveler6810
Reviews.Content: Went to Miami, and stayed at this hotel. I had no options, I'm a choice privileges member, the comfort inn is their best product. It was the only one in the area. There were 5 employees and 3 guest, i was one of them and not even a how can i help you. Tried to talk to one of them and answered the phone instead, finally after 10 minutes, i told them that i had a reservation. Room is definitely big. We were on the ninth floor, and had a king size bed. It was weird, as soon as we entered our room, some one came and slid restaurant papers under the door. Curtains was torn up a little, and TV didn't work. Couldn't find the remote the one night i stayed. They had coffee near the front desk, but no lids nor any type of creamer. wont come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good option”
Reviews.Author: eeChi
Reviews.Content: I was booked here by the airline after my connection in Miami was missed because of delays. The stay was free and I still think it was too expensive. It's near the airport in a dated building that just smells of "old" throughout. I almost booked another hotel and paid for it myself. Unless you are desperate, stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Location close to airport”
Reviews.Author: maxnelly
Reviews.Content: close to the airport, free hotel shuttle, not a fancy hotel, but okay for the price..

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: Utahgirl_10
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. The shuttle that picked us up at the airport smelled so bad and was dirty! The hotel was awful. All kinds of people hanging out in the parking lot, we felt so unsafe. Cigarette butts everywhere. BAD

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: doctorkma
Reviews.Content: We were put up in this hotel when our connecting flight out of Miami was cancelled. The room was cold and musty, the air system wasn't working so they gave us a portable space heater (fire hazard) to use but didn't keep the room warm. The internet didn't connect and despite multiple calls to the front desk and the 1-800 number it never did work. The room had ceiling tiles that were moldy and displaced. The toilet never stopped running and would only intermittently flush. Don't plan on getting much for food at the "restaurant", it was awful. I was never so glad to get out of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Not so good."”
Reviews.Author: katbar
Reviews.Content: I know this is only a hotel airport, meant for short stays, and I suppose it is not too bad. But from the time we arrived, I felt completely creeped out. There were LOTS of people just hanging out there using the pay phones in the lobby. The area is not all that great. The parking lot did have a security guard, but for some reason, that didn't make me feel ok. I couldn't sleep at night for concerns of our car being robbed. Also, thin walls. The people above us were up and walking (Heavy) at 3 am. It woke me. Not that clean. Very old. Tub was stained or dirty. Ceiling tiles stained and hanging down. Sheets looked like they had make up on them. (yuk) And just a general feeling of "don't touch anything." We ordered Dominoes Pizza delivery. DON'T DO IT. A Medium Pizza was over $19.00 and it was terrible. Took over an hour to get there. ANd was terrible. English feels like the second language at both the hotel and Dominoes. And perhaps it is. Whole thing was just kind of creepy. Oh, and it was so hard to find it, that were exhausted and un-nerved by the time we got there. So much so, we paid a huge amount of money to fly home a day early. Wish we would have just sunk that into a really nice hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for an airporthotel”
Reviews.Author: Corina82
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay an overnight near the airport this hotel is ok and not expensive. Rooms are dated en just for a night for this price is ok. Don't except much, but you also don't much. The photo's on their website look better then the real situation. Although you're close to the airport, it's very quiet! In the area there is not much to do, but in the hotel there is a bar, a little shop and an small internetroom and also free parking. Every half hour there's a free shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice stay...but need some help in the cleaning dept.....”
Reviews.Author: metsjerseygirl
Reviews.Content: First room smelled like raw sewer!! We thought we could take it, so we went to buy some air freshener to take make it smell a little better, but it kept getting worse. We finally called the desk and they said they would send someone up...........no on came so i decided to go myself....the desk was kind enough to give us an upgrade to a suite.... the suite was very large,but the bathroom needed some cleaning. There was some old urine stains dripping down the side of the toilet, and the couches had a lot of stains,.. Cleanliness is this hotel's biggest issue...but their service was great....

Reviews.Title: “Comfort...not quite!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nacwil
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel at just about 8pm and there were 6 people ahead of us at the reception. There were two attendants who took almost an hour before they got to us. By this time we were exhausted and hungry. Got to the room which was not what we booked and paid for in advance through hotels.com, instead of king bed we got two double beds, carpets looked as thought they needed to be changed and the aircon was not working. We immediately called the front desk and they said they would send someone to check it while we went to the restaurant to get something to eat. Dinner was average, service was ok. Got back to the room and aircon still not working. If we did not call back the front desk we probably would not have gotten a call from them. We were told the aircon cannot be fixed, didn't they know this all the time? I'm sure we were not the first people to use this room and complain of the aircon. Had to pack up and go back down to reception to get another room assigned, which turned out to be across the hall and a king bed! Hmmm...wasn't this what we had requested in the first instance? It just seemed as though this hotel wanted to pass off any room to anybody who would take it! Don't recommend to anybody!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews here are TOTALLY OFF - read below”
Reviews.Author: Sewstamp
Reviews.Content: First off I read some of the reviews and was ready to cancel but thought I'm going to call and chat with someone. I chatted with Vicki who has worked here for 10 years. We arrived around 6:15 on a Sunday night was promptly greeted by hotel staff - wonderful but not the sharpest pencil around. They even helped us book our shuttle to the port in the am (it would help if they all spoke ENGLISH but that's a whole 'nother story). The room we had was HUGE, 2 Q's and yep right outside our window was the airport - didn't hear a SOUND!!!! The bed was comfortable and no it's not going to be like the bed at home that you've been sleeping on for 25 years but it's a hotel for goodness sakes. The breakfast was the typical bagels/toast/cereal muffins with variety of juices and coffee - not bad for eating for free (note: IHOP just a block or 2 away and just past that was McD's). The pool isn't on the proprty but it's just at the end of the parking lot across the street - shared with another sister hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Out performed expectations â€“ happy to recommend”
Reviews.Author: paul pickburn
Reviews.Content: Out performed expectations â€“ happy to recommend Stayed just one night on arrival from UK after 20 hours travellingâ€“ picked up as promised by courtesy bus and dropped off for Car hire the following morning as planned â€“ bus runs every 30 minutes Room large, quiet, clean and comfortable Staff friendly and helpfull Breakfast was indeed better than expected with un limited quantity of typical American breakfast fare Pool large, warm and very clean There appears to be little near by to get a evening meal - Meal in bar was OK and I guess reasonable value (bar a little strange themed on the beach- paintings by staff member were of real quality)- would not want to eat there every night

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if your absolutely not picky”
Reviews.Author: mzip
Reviews.Content: We went on this trip with my husband to do some shopping and spend some time together, and decided to sacrifice on the hotel to have more money to spend on going to nice restaurants and do shopping for our baby. This hotel is really old, we arrived like at 3 am and had no problem at check in, we got a room with 2 queen size beds a fridge, microwave, coffee maker and it was a nice size. The carpet was very worn, it was very humid and the ceiling was all stained with a brownish stuff, I would say we got a bit less than what we paid for but decided to stay anyway. The big problem came next day we went out like at 10 30 am and came back at 11 30 pm and to our surprise the room was just as we had left it " It had not been cleaned" so called the front desk and the guy there told us there was no one in the hotel from housekeeping and that he couldnt do anything! but i wasnt taking no for an answer so we went down and his smart brilliant response was well whats the big deal you slept there !!! so after a bit of a fight with him for being an [-] and an idiot we changed rooms, and had that night reimbursed. all in all this hotel is old, ugly, and I have stayed at the sleep in infront of this hotel and its way better even if they are in the same category. dont stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loud and tacky”
Reviews.Author: mikehofer
Reviews.Content: Stayed there overnight after arriving on a transatlantic flight with my wife and 4 kids. We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Miami Intl. Airport, but the rooms were dirty and unaccommodating, windows almost blind of dirt and the hairdryer in the bathroom was ripped out of the wall. We had two connecting rooms overlooking the street and could hear the lift rattling all night. Don't be fooled by the hotel's photographs, there is no pool. You could use the adjacent hotel's pool across the street, which we didn't. Staff was friendly and breakfast was edible. The hotel was cheap and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “A Night in Hell!”
Reviews.Author: DreamAboutEurope
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed because I encountered all of the nightmares that any traveller would want to avoid. My story began from my driving from Key West to Miami at night. I wasn't able to find the hotel although I did a research on its location before I started my trip. The distances between the blocks were far greater than they appeared on the map near Miami Airport. Since the hotel was said to be within close proximity to the airport, I ended up getting lost at a cargo area in the airport in the middle of the night. I called the hotel to get directions. The front-desk spoke with a heavy accent so I didn't understand what he was talking about. He put me on hold forever, and never got back to me. I ended up driving back and forth around Miami Airport, feeling entirely exhausted and frustrated. I called 911. Police asked me to wait in the Sheraton Hotel so that they would send someone to help me. But no police officer showed up in almost an hour. So I asked a cab driver to guide me to the hotel, and of course, paid for his service! It was already 1 AM by the time I got to the hotel. To my surprise, there was a big crowd partying in the lobby, and there were smokers. When I got to my room, I was also surpised to hear someone peeing in my room - It turned out there was only a door separating my room from the bathroom next door. There must have been a big family staying in that room because someone would pee every once in a while. That kept me awake and it was so uncomfortable to hear strangers pee. I thought this was due to my very late check-in time because all decent rooms must have been taken and this room probably was the unwanted one left just for me. At 2-3 AM, I heard men and women talking in a room across the hallway, and it didn't stop. The wall insulation was so poor that I could hear everything they said. I called front-desk at about 3 AM to request switching a room. They told me all the rooms were booked for the night. The only thing they could do was to send a security guard up to my floor to intervene. So I got dressed for the security guard to show up. I was completedly exhausted. But the guard never showed up. But miraculously, the noise of human voice from across the hallway stopped after I made the phone call to the front desk. Then I realized that they had heard me because of the poor wall insulation. I went to sleep at about 4 AM and got up at 7 AM for my return flight home. From everything I saw and heard the night before, I imagined the people stayed at the hotel were red-eyed monsters and couldn't wait to check them out out of curiosity. To my surprise,they looked like normal people when I saw them in the breakfast area the next morning. What happened at night felt like a bad dream! BTW, I talked to the front-desk on the morning about why people talked at 2 - 3 AM. I was told that these people had travelled to US from foreign countries in a different time zone. Aha!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: UncleTravelingMatt41
Reviews.Content: We misconnected at Miami airport returning from vacation and were put up overnight here by the airline. Our first room was terrible, drop ceiling tiles broken and falling, dirty bathroom, torn carpet, and it smelled like there had just been 20 people in it chain smoking. We asked the front desk to change rooms and they did accommodate us. On route to the second room I noticed the hallways lined with dehumidifiers and the entire hotel smells of mildew. The next room at least had the ceiling in tact and I managed to lessen the mildew odor by turning off the air conditioning. The bathroom was not in great condition which I could overlook, but it was also dirty. The restaurant/bar is also very dark and dirty. I have stayed in many hotels from 1 to 4 star and have stayed at Comfort Inns in other locations. This was hands down the worst hotel/Inn I have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but it did the trick”
Reviews.Author: SixAlpha
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a layover between flights. Arrived after midnight and checked out by 5am. The room was clean, and even with two queen beds the room seemed huge. The bed was comfortable and everything in the room worked. The airport shuttle was prompt, and despite a mix-up with our reservation the front desk was friendly and helpful in getting it straightened out. We did experience trouble with the room locks, which other reviewers have reported. We never figured out a "trick" to get the lock to open.. we were just persistent with the key. If you need a place to crash, this hotel does the trick.. but at peak cruise season rates, the place is no bargain.

Reviews.Title: “great customer service”
Reviews.Author: clayzae
Reviews.Content: My wife and i had gone to the keys. There was a cruise that we had booked.After the cruise we decided to go back to miami and spent the night there. So we called around the area for a hotel.All the hotels were booked or not very clean. We finally ended up calling the comfort inn in florida 1 and they checked us in.The rooms were very clean and we enjoyed ourselves. We checked out the following morning and were on our way home.I accidentally left a very important document in the hotel ,didn't realize until i got home. At this time it was the next day. I received a call from the hotel and the manager on duty (Suchi ) informed me that they found my document and they were glad to mail it to me. Its very few people I know that would do that I am forever going to appreciate this . Bravo!!!!!!! I will definately direct my friends to this kind of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Dirty, Dirty!!!”
Reviews.Author: PamHon
Reviews.Content: Bad Things 1.Poor breakfast. Horrible! 2.Rooms smells at humidity, dusty carpet with fungus! 3.Bathroom in bad conditions. Broken! 4.If you not have a car available to go to the nearest shopping mall cost you around $25. 5.Unsafe Good Things 1.Free Shuttle from and to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Run Forrest RUN!!!”
Reviews.Author: USAFAMOM
Reviews.Content: I work for a company that is always on the road. We stay in hotels every night for up to 7 weeks at a time, booking as many as 12 rooms a night. So we know BAD when we see it. This hotel has safety issues like you wouldn't believe. One elevator was broken and from the looks of the inside of the thing it had been broken for probably 4 or 5 years. The second elevator was very slow made strange noises and you thought you were going to end up falling down the shaft. Fire exits were another issue. While the fire exits are on the outside of the building the fire hoses were gone the fire extinguishers were the size of the small ones you would have in your kitchen. Emergency lighting was non existent and the hotel tried to fix this by using large flashlights but they were missing the big battery and the light bulb!! This place was definitely NOT up to code. The rooms were clean enough, our room was huge and had been re-done however they hadn't done a good job of it. The whole place smelled kind of moldy and they had portable dehumidifiers in the halls but it didn't help Checking in and out were a nightmare due to the language issues. Lets just say English was not their first language. I would guess most of the employees didn't even speak English. We will never stay here again! There is a brand new extended stay hotel right across the street and we will stay there next time we have to be in Miami. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: AnnEliza
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel just after midnight on 6th January 2007 after waiting over one hour for hotel shuttle bus at Miami Airport. Checked in and was given key card, no porter available so took luggage ourselves to sixth floor, only to find that room was already occupied. My husband returned to hotel reception and was given another room. This time porter took luggage and opened door to room, absolutely horrified to find that large part of ceiling had fallen down. Once again returned to reception and this time we were advised that they would give us a suite. Unfortunately, the lift was then out of order and we had to transport all our luggage up the stairs. We would never stay at a Comfort Inn again. This was the worst hotel we have ever been unfortunate enough to stay in. Luckily, this was only an overnight stay en route to Caribbean Cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad customer service; dirty-smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: floridalovr
Reviews.Content: Housekeeping is very bad. Previous customers's hairs were in the toilet. Front desk staff not polite and unprofessional. Don't call them because they are not good at phone calls If you need something go there in person. Restaurant prices too high for the quality of the meal. Not much variety. It is hard to find a parking space. Once we found an unmarked parking space and parked our car but the parking lot keeper asked us to move our car because he liked that spot. (We knew we worked for the Hotel because that was our third night there) Wanna be near the airport? Get something else..this hotel is going to get you upset and you're gonna feel like you've been riped off.

Reviews.Title: “This place is not safe!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cachoeira
Reviews.Content: I mistakenly found this hotel through the the Travel Saver Coupons for $69.95, attempting to save money and stay close to the airport. This hotel is unsafe because anyone can walk in off the street and get to your room. Let me list the problems for you. 1.) Another guest in the adjoining room attempted to open my door. 2.) Sheets not changed and had holes. 3.) The room was dirty and had burn marks on the floor like someone had tried to set it on fire. 4.) Clearly the towels were left from the previous guests. Miami nor Miami Beach is not the place to look for a bargain because $100 a night doesn't guarantee your room will be clean. Research and pay the extra money to stay at a hotel that is clean. If the hotels name includes the word INN, avoid at all costs in Miami. Don't ruin your vacation trying to save money on a hotel room, it's not worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth about two stars”
Reviews.Author: Globo4368
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a relatively inexpensive airport hotel, this hotel is decent. A large property, there is half hourly shuttle service to and from the terminal. Rooms are a comfortable size, especially if you are dragging large suitcases. However, there's that typically tropical damp aroma slightly enhanced by disinfectant. On the positive side, there is free Wi-Fi if you have a laptop, a gift shop/newstand on property, and free breakfast with limited selections. Within walking distance is an IHOP, otherwise this a relatively airport industrial area that does not lend itself to strolls. My air conditioning and TV worked fair, but there was only one phone near the bed, not on the desk, nor did the cord reach. I was here for business and in order to work on my laptop and be on the phone, it had to be done in bed. Staff are pleasant, and there's a nice international feel to the place, lots of Latin American and African pilots here for training and plenty of Philippine sailors. That didn't bother me, but I'd not recommend this place for a single woman, but for one night before or after a flight it's certainly fine and worth the price. But I'd not want to spend a week here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel For Price, But Privacy Policy Questionable”
Reviews.Author: writeonjw
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stay at this hotel and as far as the accomidations are concerned, it was ok. The rooms were clean, no stains on our carpet, no hairs on the sheets , the non smoking room didnt smell like smoke. The bathroom however could have been much better. I didnt want to walk on the bathroom floor barefoot. Also, the bathtub didnt look clean, but it could have just been old, but as a result I washed my baby up (bird bath) instead of sitting her in the tub for her normal bath. The hotel did seem to be doing some painting and other remodeling so it seems they are trying to improve on some things. Overall,this is one of the better looking hotels we have stayed at in Miami. Now, the questionable part was that we had a problem with another guest looking for something in OUR room. He stated he had something in our room and was constantly knocking at our door looking for whatever he thought was in our room. There werent any personal belongings of anyone elses in the room when we got there. He failed to realize this because like i said he came to our room several times asking about various things. Then, 6am the morning we were to check out he came banging on our door to verify what city we were from. I say verify because he said the city name. The only way he could have known that is if one of the hotel staff told him. We didnt wear, say or have anything with our city name on it. The manager of the front desk tried to asure us that no personal info was given out by her staff because its against their "privacy policy". Well, to that I say, it's against the law to rob a bank but people still do it. OTHER HOTEL PLUSES: * Bar in hotel * Several chain food establishments very close ie:Mcdonalds,IHOP,Taco Bell,Dennys * No airport/traffic noise

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a layover”
Reviews.Author: TVChick16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on July 2, 2005 since we had an overnight layover in Miami on our way to Aruba. I chose this hotel because I had some Choice Privileges points to use, so the stay was free. We waited for the airport shuttle for about 15 minutes - the airport shares it's shuttle with the Holiday Inn, so both names are written on the side. The ride from the airport to the hotel was only about 10 minutes. We arrived at the hotel around 10 AM, and our room wasn't ready yet which we expected since since check-in wasn't until 3 PM. We asked if it was possible to use the pool while we waited for our room to be ready, and the front desk staff was very accomodating. They gave us towels, and we changed into our bathing suits in the bathrooms located in the lobby area. The concierge took our bags as well so that we didn't have to carry them to the pool with us. Another bonus was that because we arrived before the continental breakfast buffet ended, the front desk staff said that we could partake in that. Although we had eaten breakfast on the plane we were still hungry, and were happy to eat for free again! The breakfast bar consisted of cereal, muffins, bagels, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, juices, milk and coffee. It was adequate and exactly what I expected of a Comfort Inn. After eating we ventured over to the pool. The pool is actually at the Sleep Inn across the street which is a little strange, but the street isn't a busy one, so it wasn't a big deal. The pool was of a decent size and it was clean and not crowded at all. We stayed at the pool for a couple hours and went back to the hotel around 1 PM to see if our room was ready, and it was. Our room was pretty large. We had a room with one king sized bed and it was spacious. The amenities in the room were typical of a Comfort Inn. We brought our laptop computer with us and used the free wireless internet in the room which was nice. We decided to venture to South Beach that afternoon. We had been to Miami a few times before and knew our way around, but we decided just to take the bus instead of renting a car. There is a bus that runs right by the hotel. We had to transfer, and it took us almost an hour to get to South Beach - probably not worth it in the long run, but we were trying to save some money. It was harder to get back to the hotel in the evening because the last bus heading past the hotel leaves South Beach around midnight. We ended up taking a bus to the airport around 2 AM and calling the hotel airport shuttle to pick us up. Our check out was quick and easy, and breakfast the second day was just as it was the first day. The shuttles leave appox. every half hour to the airport, so we had no problem making our flight. I would stay here again if I had a layover, but I would not choose this hotel as a vacation hotel since it's too far away from the things that I enjoy. It met the needs of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night. Hotel was just OK for what I had paid. Had two goes at getting into my room with the key, no success, had to go back to reception twice then they gave my another room. Stains on carpet in bedroom and a bit tried. Breakfast was good but very busy. Shuttle to and from airport work well.

Reviews.Title: “Average. Learn spanish before you arrive”
Reviews.Author: Emmar01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the CI for 3 nights mainly because some colleagues got a good rate of US$60 per night. Lured by the free shuttle from the airport, I waited outside for an hour searching in vain as all the other hotel chains' shuttles went by. I later realised that the logo is on the side of the shuttle, so by the time it passes and you see the sign its too late. I was forced to spring for a taxi at $12. The hotel itself is good, but everybody speka Spainsh so learn at least some hotel phrases. Very few speak English, even fewer speak understandable English. Rates for internet access are $1.50 to start up and $0.35 every minute. I would stay again if I got the same rate, but I think that the average traveller will pay anywhere between $70-100 per night.
